other_tests.findings: Elevated ACTH levels (1250 pg/ml) in Patient 1; ACTH levels also elevated in patients 2 and 3.

Cortisol did not respond to stimulation with cosyntropin in patient 1; patient 2 had low basal cortisol (6.2 µg/dl) and no cortisol response to stimulation; patient 3 had normal cortisol (11.3 µg/dl) but did not respond to stimulation.
Mildly elevated PRA in patients 1 (5.3 ng/ml/h), 2 (5.4 ng/ml/h), and 3 (20.2 ng/ml/h); normal range is 0.3–3.9.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Patient 1 remained well on hydrocortisone with normal PRA (1.1–2.9 ng/ml/h) over time.

other_tests.findings: Normal adrenal imaging in patient 2 and 3.
Normal CT scans did not show adrenal enlargement in both brothers.
